node.title: Significant need for growth in water and wastewater treatment sector - report
node.description: New Zealand's water sector must do more to attract a pipeline of talent in order to meet safe drinking water and improved environmental standards, a new report says.

node.title: Unvaccinated New Zealanders quietly allowed to skip MIQ
node.description: A law expert says the government's move to allow unvaccinated New Zealanders to skip MIQ show the rules are changing with the country's evolving Omicron outbreak.

node.title: Foreign Minister promises more sanctions on Russia
node.description: Foreign Minister Nanaia Mahuta has promised more sanctions on Russia with officials working now to identify Russian interests in New Zealand. Audio

node.title: McConnell says "vast majority" of Republicans "totally behind" Ukraine
node.description: GOP Rep. Madison Cawthorn of North Carolina was filmed telling supporters that Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy is a "thug."

node.title: Transcript: Senate Minority Leader Mitch McConnell on "Face the Nation"
node.description: The following is a transcript of an interview with Senate Minority Leader Mitch McConnell that aired Sunday, March 20, 2022, on "Face the Nation."

node.title: Heavy rain warning into evening as storm moves across North Island
node.description: North Island residents are being warned to take care on the roads today, with heavy rain and thunderstorms forecast and the possibility of tornadoes.

node.title: Transcript: Ukrainian Ambassador Oksana Markarova on "Face the Nation"
node.description: The following is a transcript of an interview with Ukrainian Ambassador to the U.S. Oksana Markarova that aired Sunday, March 20, 2022, on "Face the Nation."

node.title: Unvaccinated US man planning trip to NZ with illegally-obtained certificate
node.description: An unvaccinated man plans on travelling to New Zealand - and there's no way to tell he hasn't had the jab.

node.title: Moana Pasifika suffer heavy home defeat
node.description: Moana Pasifika have been convincingly beaten by the Chiefs 59-12 in their Super Rugby Pacific match at Mt Smart Stadium.

node.title: Super Rugby stumbles while Six Nations shines
node.description: Analysis - With the Six Nations tournament coming to a climactic end, the benchmark for test rugby now belongs in the Northern Hemisphere, writes Jamie Wall. Video

node.title: Tom Walsh back in the medals at indoor World Championships
node.description: Tom Walsh claims a fourth successive shot put World Athletics Indoor Championship podium finish.

node.title: England prevail over New Zealand in a thriller
node.description: England have knocked New Zealand out of the Womens Cricket World Cup after beating them by 1 wicket at Eden Park.

node.title: Transcript: Dr. Scott Gottlieb on "Face the Nation"
node.description: The following is a transcript of an interview with Dr. Scott Gottlieb that aired Sunday, March 20, 2022, on "Face the Nation."

node.title: Transcript: Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin on "Face the Nation"
node.description: The following is a transcript of an interview with Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin that aired Sunday, March 20, 2022, on "Face the Nation."

node.title: Austin vows "significant reaction" if Russia uses chemical, biological weapons
node.description: "This is a very serious step and as you heard our president say, we won't take that lightly," Austin said.

node.title: Shooting at Arkansas car show kills at least 1, wounds 24
node.description: One person was in custody and authorities were searching for others who may have fired into the crowd Saturday evening, police said.

node.title: Defence Minister to travel to Fiji and Australia tomorrow
node.description: Peeni Henare is set to meet his defence counterparts, attend remembrance ceremonies and tour military camps during the five-day trip.

node.title: Transcript: Chinese Ambassador to the U.S. Qin Gang on "Face the Nation"
node.description: The following is a transcript of an interview with Chinese Ambassador to the U.S. Qin Gang that aired Sunday, March 20, 2022, on "Face the Nation."

node.title: Pianist Jeremy Denk on how practice makes perfect
node.description: In his new book, "Every Good Boy Does Fine," the acclaimed classical pianist professes love for what many music students actually learn to hate: practice.

node.title: Why Sandra Bullock is taking a pause from movies
node.description: The Oscar-winning actress says her latest film, the comic adventure "The Lost City," will be her last for a while – and she's not sure how long "a while" will be.

node.title: Addressing the pandemic's mental health fallout
node.description: Unresolved grief is just one aspect of how COVID-19 has created widespread mental health suffering – a second pandemic, as it were. Particularly affected are children, more than 140,000 of whom have lost a parent or a caregiver.

node.title: Who is Ketanji Brown Jackson?
node.description: Longtime friends of the highly-esteemed judge explain why they believe Jackson's nomination to the Supreme Court (if confirmed, she would be the first Black woman to serve on the nation's highest court) is a testament to her brilliance and passion for the law.

node.title: "Putting It Together": An ode to the art of making art
node.description: Mandy Patinkin, Bernadette Peters and writer-director James Lapine connect the dots of how the classic Stephen Sondheim musical "Sunday in the Park with George" - inspired by a pointillist painting - broke new ground on Broadway.

node.title: The plight of Ukrainians fleeing Putin's war
node.description: Three million people have left Ukraine since the start of the Russian invasion, creating a refugee crisis that the world is scrambling to address.

node.title: Why Russia's tank war stalled in Ukraine
node.description: With Russia's invasion of Ukraine in its fourth week, Gen. Frank McKenzie, commander of CENTCOM, discusses how Putin's plan to take the capital of Kyiv with a lightning strike using his vaunted tank army has been foiled – and what it means for Ukraine going forward.

node.title: Haunting photographs of Ukrainian refugees
node.description: Photojournalist Peter Turnley spent a week along the Ukraine-Poland border, capturing images of Ukrainians fleeing the Russian invasion.

node.title: Ukraine says Russia bombed art school sheltering 400 in city of Mariupol
node.description: It was the second time in less than a week that city officials reported a public building where residents had taken shelter coming under attack.

node.title: Zelenskiy says Russia wages 'terror', Mariupol says thousands deported
node.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said Russia's siege of the port city of Mariupol was "a terror that will be remembered for centuries to come", while local authorities said thousands of…

node.title: Covid-19 update: Nine deaths, 12,020 community cases, 957 in hospital
node.description: There have been nine new deaths of people with Covid-19 reported today, with the number of new community cases dropping sharply from more than 18,000 to 12,020.

node.title: Man shot by police in Invercargill had approached officer with knife - police
node.description: Police say the man who yesterday was shot by police in Invercargill had approached officers with a knife after confronting motorists on State Highway 1 near Dacre.
